10 Brain::Brain() : Node() {
11  publisher = nh.advertise<interactive_robot_hand::Grip>("grip", 1);
12  subscriber = nh.subscribe<interactive_robot_hand::See>("/eyes/see", 1, &Brain::see, this);
13  force = 3.0;
14 }

20 void Brain::see(const interactive_robot_hand::See::ConstPtr& message) {
21 
22  // Grab the object when it is close
23  if(message->distance < 85.0 && active) {
24 
25  // Close the hand with the correct amount of force
26  grip(force);
27  active = false;
28 
29  }
30 
31 }
32 
33 void Brain::spin() {
34 
35  while(ros::ok()) {
36 
37  // Get user input
38  ROS_INFO("Enter the amount of force in newton and press enter to start:");
39  std::cin.clear();
40  std::cin >> force;
41  grip(1.0, true); //< Open the hand
42  active = true;
43 
44  // Wait for hand to close
45  ros::Rate rate(10);
46  while(ros::ok() && active) {
47  rate.sleep();
48  ros::spinOnce();
49  }
50 
51  // Hand closed, give the user the option to let go of the object by pressing enter
52  ROS_INFO("Press enter to let go of the object");
53  if(ros::ok()) {
54  std::cin.clear();
55  std::cin.ignore(std::numeric_limits<std::streamsize>::max(), '\n');
56  std::cin.get();
57  grip(1.0, true); //< Open the hand
58  }
59 
60  }
61 }
62 
63 void Brain::grip(float newton, bool open) {
64 
65  // Create a grip message
66  interactive_robot_hand::Grip grip;
67  grip.force = newton;
68  grip.open = open;
69 
70  // Publish it and make sure ROS processes the message
71  publisher.publish(grip);
72  ros::spinOnce();
73 
74  // Log the action
75  if(open) {
76  ROS_INFO("Opening hand with force [%f]", grip.force);
77  } else {
78  ROS_INFO("Closing hand with force [%f]", grip.force);
79  }
80 
81 }
82 
83 int main(int argc, char **argv) {
84  ros::init(argc, argv, "brain");
85  Brain brain;
86  brain.spin();
87  return 0;
88 }
